storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to detect overlapping appointments to avoid double bookings

testCases.title: Validate detection of overlapping appointments
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling system is accessible and operational
At least one resource is available in the system
User has permissions to create and modify appointments
Database is in a clean state with no existing conflicts

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Appointment scheduling page loads successfully with all fields visible

steps.action: Select a resource from the available resources dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and displayed in the resource field

steps.action: Enter appointment details: Date (today's date), Start time (10:00 AM), End time (11:00 AM), and other required fields
steps.expectedResult: All appointment details are entered and displayed correctly in the form

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Create Appointment' button
steps.expectedResult: Appointment is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and appointment appears in the schedule

steps.action: Navigate back to the appointment scheduling interface to create a new appointment
steps.expectedResult: New appointment form is displayed and ready for input

steps.action: Select the same resource used in the first appointment
steps.expectedResult: Same resource is selected and displayed in the resource field

steps.action: Enter overlapping appointment details: Same date, Start time (10:30 AM), End time (11:30 AM), and other required fields
steps.expectedResult: Overlapping appointment details are entered in the form

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Create Appointment' button
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays an alert/warning message indicating an overlapping appointment exists

steps.action: Review the conflict alert details displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays accurate conflicting appointment details including resource name, original appointment time (10:00 AM - 11:00 AM), conflicting time period (10:30 AM - 11:00 AM), and appointment ID or reference

steps.action: Verify that the overlapping appointment was not saved to the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Only the first appointment is visible in the schedule; the overlapping appointment was not created

postconditions: Only one appointment exists for the resource in the specified time slot
Conflict alert has been displayed and acknowledged
System remains in a consistent state with no double bookings
Original appointment remains unchanged

testCases.title: Verify conflict detection latency under 2 seconds
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling system is accessible and operational
At least one resource with an existing appointment is available
Performance monitoring tool or browser developer tools are available to measure response time
System is under normal load conditions

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Network tab to monitor request timing
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and Network tab is active and recording

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Appointment scheduling page loads successfully

steps.action: Create a baseline appointment: Select a resource, enter Date (today), Start time (2:00 PM), End time (3:00 PM), and save
steps.expectedResult: Baseline appointment is created successfully and visible in the schedule

steps.action: Clear the Network tab in developer tools to start fresh timing measurement
steps.expectedResult: Network tab is cleared and ready to record new requests

steps.action: Start a timer and create an overlapping appointment: Select the same resource, enter Date (today), Start time (2:30 PM), End time (3:30 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Overlapping appointment details are entered in the form

steps.action: Click 'Save' button and immediately note the timestamp
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and conflict detection begins

steps.action: Observe when the conflict alert appears on screen and note the timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert is displayed on screen

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between clicking 'Save' and the conflict alert appearing
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is calculated successfully

steps.action: Verify the calculated time in the Network tab by checking the response time of the conflict detection API call
steps.expectedResult: Network tab shows the API response time for conflict detection is under 2 seconds (≤ 2000ms)

steps.action: Repeat steps 4-9 for modifying an existing appointment to create a conflict
steps.expectedResult: Modification conflict detection also completes within 2 seconds

postconditions: Conflict detection latency is documented and verified to be under 2 seconds
System performance meets the specified requirement
No appointments were saved that caused conflicts
System remains responsive and operational

testCases.title: Ensure logging of detected conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role and has access to conflict logs

steps.action: Navigate to the appointment scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Appointment scheduling page loads successfully

steps.action: Create a first appointment: Select Resource 'Conference Room A', Date (today), Start time (9:00 AM), End time (10:00 AM), and save
steps.expectedResult: First appointment is created successfully and saved to the schedule

steps.action: Note the current system time before creating the conflicting appointment
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded for later verification

steps.action: Attempt to create an overlapping appointment: Select same Resource 'Conference Room A', Date (today), Start time (9:30 AM), End time (10:30 AM), and click Save
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays an alert without saving the appointment

steps.action: Acknowledge or close the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is dismissed and user returns to the scheduling interface

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict logs section (may be under Admin, Reports, or Audit Logs menu)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict logs page or section loads successfully

steps.action: Search or filter logs for conflicts that occurred around the noted timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Log entries are filtered and displayed for the relevant time period

steps.action: Locate the log entry for the conflict just triggered
steps.expectedResult: A log entry exists for the detected conflict with a timestamp matching the conflict occurrence time

steps.action: Review the log entry details for completeness

steps.action: Verify the timestamp format and accuracy in the log entry

steps.action: Verify all resource details are accurately logged

postconditions: Conflict is logged in the system with complete metadata
Log entry is persistent and retrievable
No conflicting appointment was saved to the schedule
Audit trail is maintained for compliance and review purposes

storyTitle: As Resource Manager, I want to detect double bookings of resources to optimize utilization

testCases.title: Validate detection of double bookings for resources
preconditions: User is logged in with Resource Manager role
Resource management system is accessible and operational
Multiple resource types (rooms, equipment) are configured in the system
User has permissions to create and modify resource bookings
Database is in a clean state with no existing booking conflicts

steps.action: Navigate to the resource booking interface
steps.expectedResult: Resource booking page loads successfully with all booking fields and resource list visible

steps.action: Select a resource type 'Equipment' from the resource type dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Equipment resource type is selected and available equipment list is displayed

steps.action: Select a specific resource 'Projector-001' from the equipment list
steps.expectedResult: Projector-001 is selected and displayed in the resource field

steps.action: Enter booking details: Date (tomorrow's date), Start time (1:00 PM), End time (3:00 PM), Purpose 'Team Presentation', and other required fields
steps.expectedResult: All booking details are entered correctly and displayed in the form

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Book Resource' button
steps.expectedResult: Booking is saved successfully, confirmation message appears, and booking is visible in the resource schedule

steps.action: Navigate back to the resource booking interface to create a new booking
steps.expectedResult: New resource booking form is displayed and ready for input

steps.action: Select the same resource type 'Equipment' and the same resource 'Projector-001'
steps.expectedResult: Projector-001 is selected again in the new booking form

steps.action: Enter overlapping booking details: Same date (tomorrow), Start time (2:00 PM), End time (4:00 PM), Purpose 'Client Meeting', and other required fields
steps.expectedResult: Overlapping booking details are entered in the form

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Book Resource' button
steps.expectedResult: System detects the double booking conflict and displays an alert/warning message to the Resource Manager

steps.action: Review the conflict alert details displayed on screen
steps.expectedResult: Alert shows accurate conflicting booking information including: Resource name (Projector-001), Resource type (Equipment), Original booking time (1:00 PM - 3:00 PM), Conflicting time period (2:00 PM - 3:00 PM), Original booking purpose, Booking reference numbers

steps.action: Verify that the overlapping booking was not saved to the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Only the first booking for Projector-001 is visible in the schedule; the double booking was prevented

steps.action: Check the resource availability calendar for Projector-001
steps.expectedResult: Calendar shows Projector-001 as booked only from 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM tomorrow, with no double booking

postconditions: Only one booking exists for Projector-001 in the specified time slot
Double booking alert has been displayed and acknowledged
System maintains data integrity with no conflicting bookings
Resource utilization data remains accurate
Original booking remains unchanged and valid

testCases.title: Ensure logging of resource booking conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Resource Manager role
User has permissions to access conflict logs and audit trails
Resource management system is accessible and operational
Logging functionality is enabled and configured correctly
At least one resource is available for booking
Log viewing interface is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the resource booking interface
steps.expectedResult: Resource booking page loads successfully

steps.action: Create a first booking: Select Resource Type 'Room', Resource 'Training Room 3', Date (next Friday), Start time (2:00 PM), End time (4:00 PM), Purpose 'Training Session', and save
steps.expectedResult: First booking is created successfully and saved to the system

steps.action: Note the current system timestamp before triggering the conflict
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded (e.g., 2024-01-15 14:23:45) for later log verification

steps.action: Attempt to create a double booking: Select Resource Type 'Room', Resource 'Training Room 3', Date (next Friday), Start time (3:00 PM), End time (5:00 PM), Purpose 'Workshop', and click Save
steps.expectedResult: System detects the double booking conflict and displays an alert without saving the booking

steps.action: Read and acknowledge the conflict alert message
steps.expectedResult: Alert is acknowledged and dismissed, user returns to booking interface

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict logs section (typically under Reports, Audit Logs, or System Logs menu)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict logs page loads successfully with search and filter options visible

steps.action: Apply filters: Set date/time range around the noted timestamp, Resource Type 'Room', and Conflict Type 'Double Booking'
steps.expectedResult: Filters are applied and log entries are filtered accordingly

steps.action: Search for the log entry corresponding to the triggered double booking conflict
steps.expectedResult: Log entry for the conflict is found and displayed in the results

steps.action: Click on or expand the log entry to view full details
steps.expectedResult: Complete log entry details are displayed

steps.action: Verify the log entry contains the conflict timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is present and matches the time when conflict was detected (within seconds of noted time)

steps.action: Verify the log entry contains resource information
steps.expectedResult: Log shows: Resource ID, Resource Name (Training Room 3), Resource Type (Room)

steps.action: Verify the log entry contains original booking details
steps.expectedResult: Log shows: Original booking time (2:00 PM - 4:00 PM), Original booking purpose (Training Session), Original booking ID/reference

steps.action: Verify the log entry contains conflicting booking attempt details

steps.action: Verify the log entry contains user information

steps.action: Export or print the log entry for documentation
steps.expectedResult: Log entry is successfully exported in the required format (PDF, CSV, or print)

postconditions: Double booking conflict is fully logged with complete metadata
Log entry is persistent and retrievable for audit purposes

Audit trail is maintained for compliance and reporting

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to support conflict detection for recurring events to prevent repeated scheduling errors

testCases.title: Validate detection of conflicts in recurring events
preconditions: User has Scheduler role with permissions to create events
Scheduling database is accessible and operational
Conflict detection engine is enabled
User is authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the event creation interface
steps.expectedResult: Event creation form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Enter event details: Title='Weekly Team Meeting', Start Time='10:00 AM', End Time='11:00 AM', Recurrence Pattern='Weekly', Days='Monday', Start Date='Current Date', End Date='3 months from current date'
steps.expectedResult: All event details are populated correctly in the form

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create Event' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the recurring event, processes the recurrence pattern, and displays success message 'Recurring event created successfully'. Event is saved to the scheduling database

steps.action: Navigate to create a new event that conflicts with the recurring event
steps.expectedResult: New event creation form is displayed

steps.action: Enter conflicting event details: Title='Training Session', Start Time='10:30 AM', End Time='11:30 AM', Date='Next Monday' (overlaps with recurring event instance)
steps.expectedResult: Event details are entered into the form

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create Event' button
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict with the recurring event instance and displays a conflict alert message containing: conflicting event name ('Weekly Team Meeting'), date and time of conflict, and details about the recurring pattern

steps.action: Review the conflict alert details
steps.expectedResult: Alert clearly identifies the specific instance(s) of the recurring event that conflict, shows the overlapping time period, and provides options to modify or cancel the new event

postconditions: Recurring event remains saved in the system
Conflicting event is not saved until conflict is resolved
Conflict alert is displayed to the user
System maintains data integrity with no duplicate or overlapping events

steps.action: Measure the time from submission to conflict alert display
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection and alert generation completes within 3 seconds

testCases.title: Validate secure access to conflict logs
preconditions: Logging system contains existing conflict log entries
Role-based access control is configured and enabled
Two user accounts are available: one unauthorized user without log access permissions and one authorized user with log access permissions
Conflict logs API endpoint (GET /conflict-logs) is operational
Security and authentication mechanisms are active

steps.action: Log into the system using credentials of an unauthorized user (user without permissions to view conflict logs)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the conflict logs interface or reporting tool
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays an error message such as 'Access Denied' or 'You do not have permission to view conflict logs'

steps.action: Attempt to directly access the GET /conflict-logs API endpoint using the unauthorized user's authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions. No log data is returned

steps.action: Verify that no conflict log data is displayed or accessible to the unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized user cannot view, retrieve, or access any conflict log entries. Security controls prevent unauthorized access

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out from the system

steps.action: Log into the system using credentials of an authorized user (user with permissions to view conflict logs)
steps.expectedResult: Authorized user is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict logs interface or reporting tool
steps.expectedResult: System grants access and displays the conflict logs interface

steps.action: Access the GET /conflict-logs API endpoint using the authorized user's authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 200 OK status code with conflict log data. Logs are retrieved successfully within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify that conflict log entries are displayed with complete information including filtering options by date, resource, and conflict type
steps.expectedResult: Authorized user can view all conflict logs with complete metadata. Filtering options are available and functional. Log retrieval response time is under 2 seconds

postconditions: Unauthorized users remain unable to access conflict logs
Authorized users can successfully access and retrieve conflict logs
Security controls are validated and functioning correctly
Access attempts are logged for security audit purposes
Role-based access control is enforced properly

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to handle concurrent scheduling operations without missing conflicts

testCases.title: Validate conflict detection under concurrent scheduling
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational and accessible
Database has concurrency controls enabled
100 test user accounts are created and authenticated
Test environment can support 100 concurrent connections
Baseline appointments exist in the system for conflict scenarios
Performance monitoring tools are configured
API endpoints POST /appointments and PUT /appointments/{id} are available

steps.action: Prepare 100 concurrent scheduling requests with a mix of new appointments and modifications, ensuring at least 20% have intentional time/resource conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Test data set is prepared with appointments scheduled for overlapping time slots and resources

steps.action: Initiate 100 concurrent users to simultaneously create and modify appointments using POST /appointments and PUT /appointments/{id} endpoints
steps.expectedResult: All 100 requests are submitted to the system within a 2-second window

steps.action: Monitor system processing of all 100 concurrent operations
steps.expectedResult: System accepts and processes all 100 operations without crashes, timeouts, or rejected requests

steps.action: Verify that the system detects all intentional conflicts in the concurrent operations
steps.expectedResult: All conflicting appointments (minimum 20 conflicts) are identified by the conflict detection mechanism

steps.action: Check that conflict alerts are generated for each detected conflict
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alerts are generated for all detected conflicts with accurate details about the conflicting appointments

steps.action: Verify the timing of conflict detection and alert generation
steps.expectedResult: All conflict alerts are generated within 2 seconds of operation submission

steps.action: Review system logs and database records to confirm all operations were logged
steps.expectedResult: All 100 operations are recorded in system logs with appropriate status (success or conflict)

steps.action: Validate that no false positives exist - non-conflicting appointments are successfully created/modified
steps.expectedResult: All non-conflicting appointments (approximately 80) are successfully saved without conflict alerts

steps.action: Calculate conflict detection accuracy rate
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection accuracy is 100% with zero missed conflicts and zero false positives

postconditions: All non-conflicting appointments are successfully saved in the database
All conflicting appointments are rejected or flagged with alerts
System remains stable and responsive
No data corruption or inconsistencies exist
Audit logs contain complete records of all operations
System performance metrics are within acceptable thresholds

testCases.title: Ensure data consistency during concurrent operations
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational with database concurrency controls active
Multiple test user accounts are authenticated
Baseline appointments exist that can be targeted for concurrent updates
Database transaction isolation level is properly configured
Database supports ACID properties
Monitoring tools are in place to detect lost updates or inconsistencies

steps.action: Identify 10 existing appointments in the system that will be targets for concurrent updates
steps.expectedResult: 10 appointments are selected with their current state documented (time, resource, attendees, status)

steps.action: Create test scenarios where multiple users will attempt to modify the same appointments simultaneously with overlapping time slots
steps.expectedResult: Test data prepared with 5-10 concurrent update requests per target appointment, each attempting to change time slots that would create conflicts

steps.action: Execute concurrent PUT /appointments/{id} requests from multiple users targeting the same appointments
steps.expectedResult: All concurrent update requests are submitted simultaneously to the system

steps.action: Monitor database transaction processing and locking mechanisms
steps.expectedResult: Database applies appropriate locks and ensures serialization of conflicting updates

steps.action: Verify that only one update per appointment is successfully committed when updates conflict
steps.expectedResult: Each appointment reflects exactly one successful update, with other conflicting updates properly rejected or queued

steps.action: Check for lost updates by comparing the final state of each appointment against all submitted update requests
steps.expectedResult: No updates are lost - each update request either succeeded, was rejected with conflict alert, or failed with appropriate error message

steps.action: Query the database to verify data integrity of all modified appointments
steps.expectedResult: All appointment records have valid, consistent data with no corrupted fields, orphaned records, or invalid references

steps.action: Verify that appointment timestamps, version numbers, or other concurrency control fields are correctly updated
steps.expectedResult: All concurrency control mechanisms show proper incrementation and no version conflicts exist

steps.action: Check for any phantom reads, dirty reads, or non-repeatable reads in the transaction logs
steps.expectedResult: No data anomalies detected - all transactions maintained proper isolation

steps.action: Validate that all users received appropriate responses indicating success or conflict for their update attempts
steps.expectedResult: Each user received accurate response status (200 for success, 409 for conflict, etc.) matching the actual outcome of their request

steps.action: Perform a comprehensive data consistency check across all related tables and relationships
steps.expectedResult: All foreign key relationships are intact, no orphaned records exist, and referential integrity is maintained

postconditions: All appointments in the database have consistent, valid data
No lost updates occurred during concurrent operations
Database integrity constraints are satisfied
All users received accurate feedback about their operations
Transaction logs show proper isolation and atomicity
System remains in a stable state ready for subsequent operations
